name: Light Shrimp and Pesto Pasta
author: BigShotsMom
summary: For a quick meal that's elegant enough to serve to company, you can't beat the combination of shrimp, pesto, and pasta. Using garlic scapes instead of basil and garlic gives this dish a lighter note.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place garlic scapes, Romano cheese, parsley, and walnuts in the bowl of a food processor; pulse to combine
Turn on food processor; pour in olive oil and lemon juice while processing pesto until smooth
Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil
Stir in pasta, bring back to a boil, and cook over medium heat until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes
Drain and transfer to a large bowl
Stir pesto and shrimp into the pasta
Season with salt and black pepper
Squeeze a lemon wedge over pasta and serve remaining wedges alongside
